title: Integrative language instructional design for meaning and sensibility in self-directed mathematics education: An onto-semiotic approach

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational mathematical concepts, basic educational field experience, and foundational comprehension of mathematical communication (reading·writing·speaking·reading comprehension)
context.additional_context: For in-service practitioners, focuses on understanding meaning-construction processes in mathematics education, enhancing instructional design competencies using onto-semiotic approaches, and improving learners' mathematical expression skills (writing/reading/communication/speaking).

learning_goals: Apply the core concepts of the onto-semiotic approach (object, sign, meaning) to mathematics education to explain linguistic connections (reading, writing, expression) between concepts.

Integrates symbolic, contextual, and cognitive elements in analyzing mathematical concepts to foster linguistic expression skills (speaking and writing) while building conceptual understanding and sensory perception.

Designs mobile-optimized microlearning activities to facilitate learners' meaning-making processes and develop their ability to clarify mathematical representations (reading comprehension, writing, communication).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
